ampere.definition: A constant current, if maintained in two straight parallel conductors of infinite length, of negligible circular cross-section, and placed one (1) meter apart in a vacuum, would produce between these conductors a force equal to 2 x 10⁻⁷ newton per meter of length
ampere.name: ampere

candela.definition: The luminous intensity, in a given direction, of a source that emits monochromatic radiation of frequency
candela.name: candela

kelvin.definition: The thermodynamic temperature 1/273.16 the temperature of the triple point of water.
kelvin.name: kelvin

kilogram.definition: The unit of mass equal to the international standard
kilogram.name: kilogram

meter.definition: Length of a path travelled by light in a vacuum during a time interval of 1/299792459 of a second
meter.name: meter

mole.definition: The amount of substance of a system that contains as many elementary entities as there are atoms in 0.012 kilograms of Carbon 12
mole.name: mole

second.definition: The duration of 9,192,631,770 periods of the radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the ground state of the cesium 133 atom
second.name: second
